statements: SELECT * FROM health_outcomes WHERE study_id = 1;
SELECT participant_id, step_count FROM health_outcomes WHERE heart_rate > 80;
SELECT study_id, heart_rate, blood_pressure FROM health_outcomes WHERE step_count > 10000;
SELECT * FROM health_outcomes WHERE duration_of_study BETWEEN 30 AND 60;
SELECT participant_id, duration_of_study, heart_rate FROM health_outcomes WHERE blood_pressure LIKE '%120%' ORDER BY duration_of_study DESC;
SELECT * FROM health_outcomes WHERE step_count > 1000 ORDER BY participant_id ASC;
SELECT participant_id, heart_rate FROM health_outcomes WHERE blood_pressure='Normal' AND duration_of_study > 30;
SELECT study_id, participant_id, step_count, heart_rate FROM health_outcomes WHERE participant_id IN (1,3,5);
SELECT study_id, duration_of_study FROM health_outcomes WHERE duration_of_study BETWEEN 15 AND 30 ORDER BY study_id DESC;
SELECT count(*) AS total_records FROM health_outcomes;
SELECT * FROM step_counts;
SELECT user_id, timestamp, steps FROM step_counts WHERE steps > 1000;
SELECT user_id, timestamp, steps FROM step_counts ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT user_id, timestamp, steps FROM step_counts WHERE user_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
SELECT user_id, timestamp, steps FROM step_counts WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01 00:00:00' AND '2022-01-31 23:59:59';
SELECT user_id, timestamp, steps FROM step_counts WHERE steps > 1000 ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT user_id, heart_rate, timestamp FROM health_outcomes WHERE heart_rate < 60 ORDER BY heart_rate ASC;
SELECT user_id, weight, timestamp FROM health_outcomes WHERE weight BETWEEN 50.0 AND 70.0 ORDER BY weight DESC;
SELECT * FROM step_counts INNER JOIN health_outcomes ON step_counts.user_id = health_outcomes.user_id WHERE step_counts.steps > 5000 ORDER BY step_counts.timestamp ASC;
SELECT user_id, heart_rate, timestamp FROM health_outcomes WHERE heart_rate BETWEEN 70 AND 90 ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM StepCountData WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT id, step_count, date FROM StepCountData ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT user_id, step_count FROM StepCountData WHERE step_count > 10000;
SELECT * FROM HealthOutcomeData WHERE outcome_type = 'weight' AND outcome_value < 70;
SELECT id, user_id, age FROM StudyParticipants WHERE gender = 'female';
SELECT user_id, step_count FROM StepCountData WHERE step_count > 1000 ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT user_id, outcome_type, outcome_value FROM HealthOutcomeData WHERE outcome_type = 'Heart Rate' ORDER BY outcome_value ASC LIMIT 5;
SELECT s.user_id, s.age, s.gender, h.outcome_type FROM StudyParticipants s JOIN HealthOutcomeData h ON s.user_id = h.user_id WHERE h.outcome_type = 'Blood Pressure' ORDER BY s.age DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM StepCountData WHERE date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-06-30' AND step_count > 5000 ORDER BY step_count DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT s.location, COUNT(*) AS participant_count FROM StudyParticipants s GROUP BY s.location ORDER BY participant_count DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM StepCounts;
SELECT user_id, steps FROM StepCounts WHERE steps > 1000;
SELECT id, heart_rate, blood_pressure FROM HealthOutcomes ORDER BY heart_rate DESC;
SELECT name, age, gender FROM Users WHERE age BETWEEN 20 AND 30;
SELECT * FROM StudyData WHERE study_location = 'Hospital' ORDER BY study_date DESC, study_time ASC;
SELECT * FROM StepCounts WHERE steps > 1000;
SELECT id, user_id, date FROM StepCounts WHERE user_id = 1;
SELECT u.name, s.study_date, h.heart_rate FROM Users u INNER JOIN StudyData s ON u.id = s.user_id INNER JOIN HealthOutcomes h ON u.id = h.user_id;
SELECT s.study_location, h.heart_rate, h.bmi FROM StudyData s LEFT JOIN HealthOutcomes h ON s.user_id = h.user_id;
SELECT u.id, u.name, COUNT(s.id) AS num_of_studies FROM Users u LEFT JOIN StudyData s ON u.id = s.user_id GROUP BY u.id;
SELECT * FROM step_counts;
SELECT participant_id, date, steps FROM step_counts ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT participant_id, SUM(steps) as total_steps FROM step_counts GROUP BY participant_id;
SELECT p.participant_id, p.name, d.device_type FROM participants p INNER JOIN devices d ON p.participant_id = d.participant_id;
SELECT s.flow_id, s.study_phase FROM study_flow s ORDER BY s.flow_id ASC;
SELECT name, age, gender FROM participants;
SELECT device_id, device_type, manufacturer FROM devices ORDER BY device_type DESC;
SELECT participant_id, date, steps FROM step_counts WHERE steps > 10000;
SELECT participant_id, health_score, date FROM health_outcomes ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT * FROM study_flow WHERE study_phase = 'Baseline';
